Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394468) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394468)
